name: German Beef Rouladen
author: DebbyO
summary: This is another great German recipe that reminds me of my mom's wonderful cooking.  Enjoy this unique and delicious dish!
ingredients: 8 (4 ounce) pieces round steak, pounded 1/4 inch thick
directions: Spread 1/2 tablespoon mustard over one side of each piece of meat
Sprinkle the onion, paprika, salt, and pepper evenly over the steaks
Lay one slice of bacon on each piece
Roll the steaks jelly-roll style and secure with toothpicks
Heat the canola oil in a skillet over medium heat
Cook meat on all sides until browned
Add the beef broth and water; bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium low; cover and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes
Strain the broth mixture and return liquid to the skillet
Whisk together the cornstarch and 1 cup of water
Slowly pour the cornstarch slurry into the skillet, stirring continually until the sauce has thickened, 2 to 3 minutes
Return rolls to the sauce; serve immediately
